intro: Mabrya, commonly known as the desert bell, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Malvaceae. It consists of several species, most of which are native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. Mabrya species are often used in xeriscaping due to their drought tolerance and ornamental value.
